User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-GB; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050919 Firefox/1.0.7 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-GB; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050919 Firefox/1.0.7 div on right hand of side of my page (containing weather info & map, pointing to external uri) resizes on running javascript (used to select content in a different language), since some of the text content is set to display:none with alternate css style sheets. this is done by clicking the flags & running the js code. initially, the height of this div is correct. on running the js, the right hand window resizes, but now the height is set far too small to display the content, runs correctly in Opera, Netscape, IE. reproducible in Win XP & 2000. Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. note size & content of right hand div 2. click on "select language" flags 3. note resized div Actual Results: div on right had side of page resizes, height being set incorrectly - about 10 or 20 px, too small to display even the first element, whish is an external link to an image Expected Results: div should resize to contain externally linked image, some text, then another externally linked image the html for the div in question :

The Weather Underground
detaylı bilgi için resimleri tıklayın
click on images for full details detaylı bilgi için resimleri tıklayın click on images for full details
relevant css : div { position: absolute ; overflow: hidden ; } .centered {text-align: center ; } div#rightcolumn { position: absolute ; top: 0.5em ; margin: 0 0 0 52.5em ; padding: 0 0 1em 0 ; border: 2px solid #08e ; }
comments.author: azmi@marbleheart.com
